channel.title: Comments on: Easy Baked AIP Kale & Turkey Meatballs

item.title: By: Eileen
item.dc:creator: Eileen
item.description: These were incredible! So juicy and flavorful. Definitely wish I had made extra kale sauce— next time! I served them with steamed broccoli and some seasoned rice I had leftover from an instant pot meal earlier in the week. These will definitely be on repeat!!
item.content:encoded: These were incredible! So juicy and flavorful. Definitely wish I had made extra kale sauce— next time! I served them with steamed broccoli and some seasoned rice I had leftover from an instant pot meal earlier in the week. These will definitely be on repeat!!

item.title: By: Jo
item.dc:creator: Jo
item.description: Your picture shows the kale puree separate in the bottom of the skillet, but don't the instructions say to mix the ground turkey with the kale puree and then bake them on a sheet? Then do you put them back in the skillet? I'm confused.
item.content:encoded: Your picture shows the kale puree separate in the bottom of the skillet, but don’t the instructions say to mix the ground turkey with the kale puree and then bake them on a sheet? Then do you put them back in the skillet? I’m confused.

item.title: By: Stephanie
item.dc:creator: Stephanie
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/easy-baked-aip-kale-turkey-meatballs/#comment-435">Jo</a>.
Hi Jo, sorry if there is any confusion. The kale puree is mixed in with the ground turkey and then baked in the oven per the instructions. I had leftover kale puree and used it for photographic purposes.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jo.

Hi Jo, sorry if there is any confusion. The kale puree is mixed in with the ground turkey and then baked in the oven per the instructions. I had leftover kale puree and used it for photographic purposes.
